page.title: 14COASTAL EROSION
page.content: The sea crashes against the cliffs and digs away at the mud from the bottom. Soon the top of the cliff drops off and gets washed away.The soil that gets washed away collects down the coast at Spurn Point.Every year about a metre of the land is lost to erosion Three villages,Hyde,Withow and Cleeton have been washed from this area.There are different ways we could stop the cliffs from eroding.A concrete wall could be built but this would cost half a million pounds for every hundred metres.We could tip rubbish at the cliffs but this would look very messy.Mr Walker at Beach Bank built a sea wall of wood and rubbish to stop the sea eroding.At the present rate of erosion we estimate the land where the school is,will be washed away in a about 850 years. by Michelle Baker
